metadata.summary: Comprehensive OS support matrix and command reference showing which commands work on each platform and their corresponding response event types
metadata.primary_use_case: Reference guide for selecting appropriate commands based on target OS and understanding response events

extracted_apis.description: Retrieve artifacts from endpoint (macOS, Windows, Linux)
Deny process tree execution (macOS, Windows, Linux)
Find files by hash in directory (macOS, Windows, Linux) - emits DIR_FINDHASH_REP
List directory contents (macOS, Windows, Linux) - emits DIR_LIST_REP
Resolve DNS query (all platforms) - emits DNS_REQUEST
Retrieve file contents (macOS, Windows, Linux) - emits FILE_GET_REP
Get file hash (macOS, Windows, Linux) - emits FILE_HASH_REP
Get network connections (macOS, Windows, Linux) - emits NETSTAT_REP
Kill process (macOS, Windows, Linux) - emits OS_KILL_PROCESS_REP
Extract strings from process memory (macOS, Windows, Linux) - emits MEM_STRINGS_REP

cross_refs.description: Read commands overview first to understand how to send commands and parse responses
Each command's REP event type is documented in the events reference
